meanings.definition: The ability of a molecule or atom to become polarized in the presence of an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The polarizability of the atom determines how it responds to the electric field.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the polarizability of molecules to understand their behavior in different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The polarizability of the molecule was so high that it danced around in the electric field.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had a polarizability that attracted new ideas like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The polarizability of the atom was like a chameleon, changing its nature in the electric field.

meanings.definition: The measure of how easily an electron cloud can be distorted by an external electric field.
meanings.sent1: The electron cloud's polarizability affected its interaction with the electric field.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use polarizability to explain how electrons behave under different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The electron cloud's polarizability was so high that it wiggled in the electric field.
meanings.sent4: His words had a polarizability that could sway even the most stubborn minds.
meanings.sent5: The polarizability of the electron cloud was like a delicate dance in the electric field.
